clinical_study.brief_title: A Pharmacovigilance Study of Torsade de Pointes
clinical_study.official_title: A Pharmacovigilance Study of Torsade de Pointes in the Food and Drug Administration Adverse Event Reporting System Using Data Mining Algorithms

brief_summary.textblock: Many cardiac and non-cardiac drugs are associated with TdP that may constitute a significant problem because of sudden cardiac death. This study aims to present a comprehensive overview and disproportionality analysis of TdP cases reported to the Food and Drug Administration Adverse Event Reporting System (FAERS) in order to identify new signals of TdP.

detailed_description.textblock: Drug-induced Torsade de Pointes (TdP) is a serious but an overlooked adverse drug reaction because a wide range of marketed drugs associated with TdP are commonly prescribed in routine practice. Owing to the heightened concern of a vast number of drug-TdP associations including newly approved drugs, the investigators, therefore, aims to investigate drug-TdP associations by performing disproportionality analysis in order to identify new signals of TdP utilizing the individual case reports of TdP in the FAERS database.

primary_outcome.measure: Identification of drugs associated with TdP
primary_outcome.time_frame: Cases reported to the FAERS database till 31/03/2019
primary_outcome.description: The search includes MedDRA (v-22) Preferred Term, "Torsade de Pointes (MedDRA code: 10044066) for the identification of all TdP case reports and drugs.

primary_outcome.measure: Identification of new signals of TdP
primary_outcome.time_frame: Cases reported to the FAERS database till 31/03/2019

secondary_outcome.measure: Validation of already known drug-TdP associations
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cases reported to the FAERS database till 31/03/2019

secondary_outcome.measure: Stratification of new signals with respect to age
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cases reported to the FAERS database till 31/03/2019

secondary_outcome.measure: Stratification of new signals with respect to gender
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cases reported to the FAERS database till 31/03/2019

secondary_outcome.measure: Trends of TdP reports in FAERS database
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cases reported to the FAERS database till 31/03/2019

secondary_outcome.measure: Description of the population of patients having TdP
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cases reported to the FAERS database till 31/03/2019

clinical_study.condition: Torsades de Pointe Caused by Drug

arm_group.description: Torsade de Pointes induced by drugs reported to the FAERS database from inception till first quarter of 2019 (1990-2019)

intervention.description: All drugs having â‰¥10 TdP cases reported in the FAERS database

study_pop.textblock: Patients presented with TdP treated for any disease

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- TdP cases reported in the FAERS database till 31/03/2019
- Adverse event reported was including the MedDRA term: Torsade de Pointes
Exclusion Criteria:
- Drugs with less than 10 TdP reports

facility.name: Department of Pharmacy, University of Peshawar
